Men who can get no joy out of books , or pictures , or music , or even themselves . Tired , worried men who are afraid to quit because they have no resource except to make money — money with which to buy vulgar excitement for their own debased souls . Why , Mr. Goodkind , I have an income that you would n't suggest to your bookkeeper , but I have peace , and health , and friends , and time to read , and think , and dream , and help . Which of us is the rich man ?

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: But if everybody lived your way , what would become of the world 's work ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: Living that way is my contribution to the world 's work . Another man 's might be selling shoes , or writing plays , or digging ditches . Doing his job does n't prevent any man from doing his bit . “ From every man according to his ability , to every man according to his needs . ” And every man who gives his best must find his happiness .

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: I 'm afraid there would n't be much progress ... living your way .

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: That 's the second time you 've spoken of my way . It is n't my way . It 's the sum total of all that has been learned and taught . You , and Jerry , and the others have called me eccentric , and a fool , because I 'm trying to walk a path trod hard by countless feet . Was Christ eccentric ? Was Confucius a fool ? And how about Buddha and Mohammed ? What of St. Bernard , and St. Teresa , and St. Francis of Assisi — of Plato , and Zeno , and Lincoln , and Emerson , and Florence Nightingale , and Father Damien , and Octavia Hill , and all the saints and scientists , and poets and philosophers , who have lived and died in complete forgetfulness of self ? Were they fools , or were they wise men and women who had found the way to peace and happiness ? Were they failures , or were they the great successes of all Time and all Eternity ?

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: God knows !

div.stage: JERRY enters ... a dying man . He drags his legs with difficulty , and his speech is thick , but he is still cynical and defiant .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Well , you 've been the devil of a time ! I came up to see what was keeping you !

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: RisingMr. Gilchrist .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Hello , Gilchrist !

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: Crossing to C .How are you , Jerry ?

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Not so damned well ! But I 'll be all right in the Spring ! Clare 's looking after me . Clare 's a good sport . What I need now 's a run down to Palm Beach !Looks aroundSo you 're reduced to this , are you ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Going to take my job ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Why not ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: Your father understands .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Yes ... so do I ! Did n't I always say you were a nut ? That 's it ; a nut !He laughs with a laugh that begins to get the better of him .

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: Crossing rapidly to the doorCome , Jerry !

div.stage: A light rap ; GOODKIND opens . Enter MARY MARGARET . She glances at him and crosses to upper L. C. JERRY looks at her , and turns back to DAN .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: Who 's the girl ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: Your father 's waiting .

sp.speaker: JERRY
sp.p: A ’ right !...Crosses L .Some failure you 've made out of life !Turns back and leers at MARY MARGARET . In the doorway , looks at DAN .Wheels ... by God ! Wheels !He laughs , and exits .

sp.speaker: GOODKIND
sp.p: Goes to DAN and takes his handI wonder if you 're the failure , after all .Returns to the door .Good-night !He exits .

div.stage: DAN takes his pipe from his pocket and puts it in his mouth . Some chimes , in the distance , begin the anthem “ Hark the Herald Angels Sing . ” DANIEL goes up , draws back the curtains , and throws open the window . MARY MARGARET , feeling the fresh air , draws her furs about her , happily . She turns up . DANIEL is standing with his left arm akimbo . MARY MARGARET slips her head through it , and nestles to him . They ... and we ... see the chimney pots , and the blue night sky , and one bright star .

sp.speaker: MARY MARGARET
sp.p: Mr. Gilchrist ! Is that the Star of Bethlehem ?

sp.speaker: DANIEL
sp.p: The chimes swell out , andI wonder .
